## Advance Procurement Notice for Quick Reaction Alert Project

### Project Background

This is an advance procurement notice for the construction of a Quick Reaction Alert (QRA) facility at 4 Wing Cold Lake, Alberta, Canada. The project will involve the construction of a new facility for operations, logistics, maintenance, living and sleeping accommodations, and administrative spaces.

### Project Description

The QRA facility will house six (6) aircrafts and associated staff, and will have a total floor area of approximately 6,500 m². The project will include civil works such as the construction of airfield pavement, apron, and taxiway access lane. The department of National Defense is planning to proceed with the project in Fall/Winter 2023.

### Security Requirements

To be eligible for contract award, the consultant/contractor must hold all required security clearances at the time of closing. The security clearances required include:

*   Facility Security Clearance (FSC) at the level of SECRET
*   Control Goods Program registration
*   Personnel security screening at the level of SECRET or RELIABILITY STATUS for personnel requiring access to CLASSIFIED/PROTECTED information
*   RELIABILITY STATUS for personnel requiring access to FOREIGN PROTECTED information

### Procurement Method

The procurement method for this project will be Modified Design Build.

### Tendering Process

The tendering process for this project will be competitive, open bidding.

### Contact Information

For any questions or inquiries related to the sponsorship process or this Advance Procurement Notice, please contact:

Gerry Melake, Coordinator, Contract Services, Defence Construction Canada, at (780) 594-3395 ext. 130 or gerry.melake@dcc-cdc.gc.ca.

### Disclaimer

Defence Construction Canada does not provide any assurances or guarantees regarding the success or timeliness of the sponsorship request package or a security clearance application forwarded by Defence Construction Canada to the Public Works and Government Services Canada. The processing of a sponsorship request package or a security clearance application is subject to the terms, conditions, and timelines of the Defence Construction Canada's Industrial Security Program sponsorship process and the Public Works and Government Services Canada's security clearance granting process.

*   Expected contract start date: November 1, 2023
*   Expected contract end date: November 1, 2023
